summary: An email sent to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman on December 16, 2019, with the subject 'Defiling of the Rule of Law'. The email criticizes the legal system for failing to prosecute professional misconduct and specifically references the 'Jeffrey Epstein sweetheart deal' as an example of impunity for the wealthy and powerful. It includes numerous attachments alleging various legal and ethical violations.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Recipient of the email criticizing prosecutorial misconduct and referencing the Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as an example where the 'very rich and powerful' received a 'sweetheart deal', implying impunity for crimes.

events.title: Reference to Jeffrey Epstein 'sweetheart deal'
events.description: The document references a 'Jeffrey Epstein sweetheart deal' as a prime example of how the wealthy and powerful can purchase impunity for crimes.

keyFacts: The document is an email sent to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman on December 16, 2019, criticizing systemic failures in prosecuting legal misconduct.
It explicitly cites the 'Jeffrey Epstein sweetheart deal' as a key example of impunity granted to the wealthy and powerful.
The email includes numerous attachments with titles suggesting allegations of RICO violations, fraud, cover-ups, and obstruction of justice across various institutions.
The core argument is that prosecutorial misconduct is an 'ongoing national disgrace' that is traditionally ignored.
